QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 1. The two divisions made in I Corinthians 15:44-49 are:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Milk and meat|B. Good and evil|C. Satan and demons|D. Natural and spiritual|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 2. The two invisible kingdoms in the world today are:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Communist and capitalist|B. Protestants and Catholics|C. Kingdoms of God and Satan|D. None of the above|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 3. The rulers of the kingdom of God are:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Satan and demons|B. God, Jesus, Holy Spirit|C. Both A and B|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 4. The rulers of the kingdom of Satan are:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Satan and demons|B. God, Jesus, Holy Spirit|C. Both A and B|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 5. The word "kingdom" means:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. A state|B. A territory or people over whom a king reigns|C. A group|D. A political party|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 6. The word "king" means:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. A statesman|B. A president|C. The sovereign ruler of a kingdom|D. An ambassador|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 7. Which books of the Bible tell the story of the earthly life, ministry, and teachings of King Jesus?
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The books of law|B. Historical books|C. The Gospels|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 8. The keys of the Kingdom are given to:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. God only|B. Jesus only|C. God and Jesus only|D. All true believers|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 9. The keys to the Kingdom are:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Spiritual powers to bind and lose|B. Not a Scriptural concept|C. Not really effective today|D. Not really known|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 10. You can transfer from the kingdom of Satan to the Kingdom of God by:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Self-improvement|B. Joining the church|C. Being born again|D. Joining a leading denomination|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 11. To bind something means:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. To decorate it|B. To put fetters or a bond on it|C. To release it or set it free|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 12. To loose something means:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. To decorate it|B. To put fetters or a bond on it|C. To release it or set it free|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 13. Two references which list specific sins that prevent entrance into the Kingdom of God are:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. I Corinthians 6:9-10 and Galatians 5:19-21|B. John 3:16-17 and John 3:19|C. Psalms 1:1-2 and Psalms 2:3|D. Genesis 1:1-2 and 3:15|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 14. A Biblical reference which explains how to eliminate sins preventing entrance to the Kingdom of God is:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. I John 1:8-9|B. John 3:16-17|C. Galatians 5:19-21|D. Genesis 1:1-2 and 3:15|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 15. The word "pattern" means:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. An example|B. A suggestion|C. A truth|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 16. The word "principle" means:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. An example|B. A suggestion|C. A truth|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 17. A "Biblical pattern" is:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. A spiritual truth|B. A spiritual example given in Scripture for us to imitate|C. The shape of your Bible|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 18. A "Biblical principle" is:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. A spiritual truth|B. A spiritual example given in Scripture for us to imitate|C. The shape of your Bible|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 19. The key to extending God's Kingdom is:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Repentance|B. Revolution|C. Military coups|D. Political process|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 20. "Patterns and principles of Kingdom living" refers to:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Suggestions for healthy living|B. Principles which govern life in God's Kingdom|C. Legal laws of the land|D. Denominational regulations|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 21. The foundation upon which all other Kingdom principles rest is:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Righteousness|B. Force|C. Power|D. Religious denominations|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 22. The two Kingdom laws upon which all other principles are based are:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Religion and denomination|B. Healthy diet and exercise|C. Loving God and others|D. Fasting and praying|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 23. It is important to know Kingdom principles because:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. They are necessary to maintain residency in God's Kingdom|B. Jesus said they are of primary importance|C. To reign in the future kingdom we must know its principles|D. All of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 24. Jesus came to___________________ the Old Testament law.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Destroy|B. Fulfill|C. Ignore|D. Abort|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 25. The main subject of the parables of Jesus was:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Sin|B. Power|C. The Kingdom of God|D. Hate|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 26. A parable:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Is a lie|B. Is a good story, but with no spiritual meaning|C. Never can be really understood|D. Is a natural story which illustrates a spiritual truth|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 27. Jesus used parables to teach spiritual truths about the Kingdom of God because:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. His audience was not very educated|B. He did not approve of other teaching methods|C. Those with spiritual minds could understand what He was saying|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 28. An ambassador is someone who:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Runs for political office|B. Represents his kingdom in another country|C. Is a paid professional|D. Is a secret agent|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 29. The word "witness" means:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. To spy|B. To gossip|C. One who can testify of something he experienced first hand|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 30. The extension of the Gospel of the Kingdom is an important responsibility because:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The Kingdom will not come in fullness until the Gospel is preached to all nations|B. We must take over the political systems of this world|C. Both of these|D. Neither of these|Column One Column Two|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 31. You may use your Bible on these questions. Look up a verse in Column One. Match each verse with the principle it teaches: Matthew 5:13-16
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Principle of unity|B. Principle of penetration|C. Kingdom principles are opposite of worldly ones|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 32. You may use your Bible on these questions. Look up a verse in Column One. Match each verse with the principle it teaches: I Corinthians 12:12-14
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Principle of unity|B. Principle of penetration|C. Kingdom principles are opposite of worldly ones|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 33. You may use your Bible on these questions. Look up a verse in Column One. Match each verse with the principle it teaches: Matthew 20:26
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Principle of unity|B. Principle of penetration|C. Kingdom principles are opposite of worldly ones|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 34. You may use your Bible on these questions. Look up a verse in Column One. Match each verse with the principle it teaches: Matthew 6:1-18
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Prayer principles|B. The King cares for you|C. Principles of right behavior|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 35. You may use your Bible on these questions. Look up a verse in Column One. Match each verse with the principle it teaches: Matthew 7:12
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Prayer principles|B. The King cares for you|C. Principles of right behavior|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 36. You may use your Bible on these questions. Look up a verse in Column One. Match each verse with the principle it teaches: Matthew 6:25-34
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Prayer principles|B. The King cares for you|C. Principles of right behavior|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 37. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: The poor are___________________________.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Joy|B. Conquerors|C. Filled|D. Rich|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 38. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: Sorrow brings__________________________.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Joy|B. Conquerors|C. Filled|D. Rich|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 39. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: The meek are___________________________.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Joy|B. Conquerors|C. Filled|D. Rich|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 40. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: The hungry are_________________________.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Joy|B. Conquerors|C. Filled|D. Rich|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 41. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: The merciful obtain____________________.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Outward|B. Peace|C. Mercy|D. Greatest|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 42. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: Inward rather than_________ is stressed.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Outward|B. Peace|C. Mercy|D. Greatest|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 43. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: Division instead of____________________.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Outward|B. Peace|C. Mercy|D. Greatest|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 44. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: The least are__________________________.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Outward|B. Peace|C. Mercy|D. Greatest|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 45. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: The persecuted are _________________________.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Blessed|B. First|C. Exalted|D. Greatest|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 46. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: The humble are____________________________.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Blessed|B. First|C. Exalted|D. Greatest|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 47. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: Servants are________________________________.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Blessed|B. First|C. Exalted|D. Greatest|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 48. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: The last are________________________________.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Blessed|B. First|C. Exalted|D. Greatest|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 49. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: Small becomes_______________________________.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Great|B. Lowly valued|C. Live|D. Children|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 50. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: That which is highly esteemed is_______________.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Great|B. Lowly valued|C. Live|D. Children|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 51. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: Adults become as____________________________.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Great|B. Lowly valued|C. Live|D. Children|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 52. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: You die to__________________________________.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Great|B. Lowly valued|C. Live|D. Children|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 53. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: You lose your life to_____________________it.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Loving|B. Save|C. Possible|D. Receive|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 54. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: You hate life instead of__________________it.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Loving|B. Save|C. Possible|D. Receive|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 55. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: You give and ___________________________.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Loving|B. Save|C. Possible|D. Receive|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 56. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: The impossible is_______________________.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Loving|B. Save|C. Possible|D. Receive|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 57. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: Those without sight___________________________.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Rest|B. Revealed|C. See|D. Earthly|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 58. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: You take a yoke and burden in order to__________.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Rest|B. Revealed|C. See|D. Earthly|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 59. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: Heavenly instead of_____treasures are emphasized.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Rest|B. Revealed|C. See|D. Earthly|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 60. Supply the word to complete the sentence and mark the correct letter on your answer sheet: That covered is_______________________________.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Rest|B. Revealed|C. See|D. Earthly|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 61. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: Concerned more with inward attitudes.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 62. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: Concerned more with outward actions.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 63. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: More specific.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 64. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: More inclusive.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 65. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: Letter of the law.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 66. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: Spirit of the law.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 67. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: Thou shalt not kill.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 68. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: Anger without cause is the same thing as killing.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 69. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: Do not swear by anything.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 70. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: Do not swear by thyself.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 71. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: Return good for evil.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 72. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: Return evil for evil.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 73. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: Love thy neighbor, but not necessarily your enemies.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 74. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: Love thy enemy.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 75. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: Worship depends on inward attitudes.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 76. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: Worship depends on outward actions.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 77. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: Sabbath made for man.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 78. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: Man made for Sabbath.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 79. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: Holiness is keeping man's traditions.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 80. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: Holiness is keeping God's commandments.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 81. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: Emphasis on outward holiness.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 82. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: Emphasis on inward holiness.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 83. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: Divorce for limited cause.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 84. Mark A for "old" for each statement which describes the Old Testament law. Mark B for "new" for each statement which describes New Testament Kingdom principles: Divorce for every cause.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Old Testament law|B. New Testament principle|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 85. Fornication is the worship of idols.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 86. Fornication includes all types of sexual sin.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 87. Adultery is sexual intercourse by two people not married to each other.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 88. Seditions are beliefs contrary to the Word of God.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 89. Emulations is a sin of the flesh that exhibits a desire to copy others and equal or excel them.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 90. The practice of witchcraft is not forbidden in God's Word.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 91. There is no difference between these two phrases: "Kingdom of God" and "Kingdom of Heaven".
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 92. Paul said his preaching was with words only.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 93. If you are rich, you cannot gain entrance into the Kingdom of God.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 94. Good relations exist between the Kingdom of God and the kingdom of Satan.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 95. A condition of warfare exists between the Kingdom of God and the kingdom of Satan.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 96. You can be neutral...You do not have to be part of either the kingdoms of God or Satan.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 97. The Bible teaches that you can still inherit the Kingdom of God even though you continue to walk in the lusts of the flesh and pattern your lifestyle after the world.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 98. All you must do is say Jesus is Lord and you will be assured entrance into the Kingdom of God.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 99. I completed reading the text for this course..
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 100. I completed the self-tests at the end of each chapter.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|
